com.chunkr.expressions

Interface Operation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Abs, Add, BinaryOperation, Constant, Cos, Mul, Neg, NullaryOperation, Pow, Sin, Sub, UnaryOperation, Variable

    public interface Operation
    Operations are the building blocks of mathematical expressions; operations take a specified number of operands (arity) and produce an output. Operations must be valid over all the real numbers (domain = (-inf, +inf)) and produce outputs on the real numbers (codomain subset of (-inf, +inf)).
    Author:
    ashwin
    See Also:
    NullaryOperation, UnaryOperation, BinaryOperation

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Operation.Type
      The order that operations are declared in this enumeration will determine their operation codes.

    • Method Detail

      • arity

        int arity()
        Returns the "arity," or the number of operands that this operation takes. For example; a binary operation takes 2 operands and, therefore, has an arity of 2.
        Returns:
        number of operands

      • eval

        java.math.BigDecimal eval(java.math.BigDecimal... operands)
        Evaluates the expression over the specified operands.
        Parameters:
        operands - inputs
        Returns:
        output
